alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Bexar; De Witt; Fayette; Gonzales; Guadalupe; Karnes; Kinney; Lavaca; Medina; Uvalde; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 03 at 7:59PM CST until February 04 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Adverse travel impacts due to remaining icy spots on roads and development of black ice where roads are wet after wintry precipitation has come to an end across the advisory area. Wind chills ranging as low as 0 to 10 above zero through 9 AM Friday. * WHERE...Portions of south central Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM CST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The adverse conditions could impact the Friday morning commute. Side walks and pavement could be slippery to walk on. In addition, a risk for hypothermia exists for those spending extended time outdoors and not dressed in layers and gloves.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state can be obtained at drivetexas.org. A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors...make sure you wear a hat and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Atascosa; Bexar; De Witt; Fayette; Gonzales; Guadalupe; Karnes; Kinney; Lavaca; Medina; Uvalde; Wilson
